results.title: Turner's Syndrome : trials and triumphs
results.creator_credit: Jackie Breasley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Living with Turner’s Syndrome, Jackie Breasley has had to overcome many difficulties. As she grows up, she has faced much more heartbreaking challenges. Regardless, these challenges all present Breasley with opportunities to triumph.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jackie Breasley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Living with Turner’s Syndrome, Jackie Breasley has had to overcome many difficulties. As she grows up, she has faced much more heartbreaking challenges. Regardless, these challenges all present Breasley with opportunities to triumph.

results.title: Diary of a backpack
results.creator_credit: Gabrielle Guaran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Gabrielle Guaran’s backpack tells of all the adventures taken with her owner, a woman with Turner’s Syndrome. Depsite getting old, Guaran hasn’t given up on her backpack, in much the same way she refuses to give up on the life she wants to lead.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gabrielle Guaran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Gabrielle Guaran’s backpack tells of all the adventures taken with her owner, a woman with Turner’s Syndrome. Depsite getting old, Guaran hasn’t given up on her backpack, in much the same way she refuses to give up on the life she wants to lead.

results.title: Dr Phil's story
results.creator_credit: Phil Bergman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dr Phil Bergman is a pediatrician and endocrinologist. He was encouraged to become involved with the Victorian Turner’s Syndrome Association and has since become a specialist in the field. Over the years he has contributed greatly to the care of those with Turner’s Syndrome and values support for those with the condition as much as medical advancements in the area.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil Bergman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Dr Phil Bergman is a pediatrician and endocrinologist. He was encouraged to become involved with the Victorian Turner’s Syndrome Association and has since become a specialist in the field. Over the years he has contributed greatly to the care of those with Turner’s Syndrome and values support for those with the condition as much as medical advancements in the area.

results.title: Beautiful brown eyes
results.creator_credit: David Facey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When David Facey’s daughter was born the first thing he fell in love with was her beautiful brown eyes. Ironically, it was those same eyes that told him something wasn’t quite right.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Facey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Most important question in the world
results.creator_credit: Paul Young, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Paul Young went to university, he knew he didn’t want to be a teacher. However, over time, he has seen the value of the profession and learnt that it’s not about the content, it’s about the life lessons.

results.title: Bittersweet
results.creator_credit: Maria Savarino, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When the train from Beijing to Lhasa started running again, Maria Savarino and her husband took the opportunity to visit Tibet before it had changed forever. What they found there was a bittersweet experience they will never forget but also never revisit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maria Savarino, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: For the love of...Lolo
results.creator_credit: Ayen Guinto, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Ayen Guinto lost her beloved ‘Lolo’, her family lost the glue holding them together. She remembers him and wonders if the family should use his life as inspiration to move forward.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ayen Guinto, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: When Ayen Guinto lost her beloved ‘Lolo’, her family lost the glue holding them together. She remembers him and wonders if the family should use his life as inspiration to move forward.

results.title: Under cover
results.creator_credit: Marten McEachran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Marten McEachran might be a normal schoolkid, but he also leads another, secret life. These lives co-exist happily and McEachran recognises that it is both lives that make him who he is.

results.title: My neice
results.creator_credit: Samantha Sharp, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Samantha Sharp may have become an aunty early in her life but she’s glad she is. She plays with her niece in the way that older aunts couldn’t and she cherishes the time they spend together.
